Welcome to REST API Contacts’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A fastapilimiter instance

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: Session) → Contact¶
src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session, start_date: date, end_date: date) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays fall within the given date range. The start_date and end_date parameters are both datetime objects, which represent the beginning and ending dates of the desired date range. The function uses SQLAlchemy’s extract method to compare only the month and day components of the birthday field in each contact with those same components from the start_date parameter.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • start_date – date: Filter the contacts by their birthday month and day

  • end_date – date: Specify the end date for the range of birthdays to be returned

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays fall between the start_date and end_date

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶
async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session)¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query. The function takes in a string and returns all contacts whose first name, last name, or email address contain the query.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(start_date: date = datetime.date(2023, 7, 7), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • start_date – date: Specify the start date of the range

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

query (str): The search query to use when searching for contacts. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for contacts in the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency injection

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects

Doc-author:

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed if the user has

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If there is no valid user associated with the given email address or if there are any errors during decoding or creating tokens then an HTTPException will be raised.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

An access_token and a refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A json response that contains a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user information from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A usermodel object, which is defined in the models

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
create_email_token(data: dict)¶
async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If it fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db as parameters, and returns the user object associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the header

  • db – Session: Get a database session from the dependency injection container

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the sub (subject) field from the payload. If not, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 Unauthorized.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent in the request

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent
